Tolkien-related events that took place in 1957.

content.title: January
content.content: 15 - J.R.R. Tolkien is interviewed by Ruth Harshaw for the NBC radio program "Carnival of Books".

content.title: March
content.content:
1 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes letter 195b.
21 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes letter 196.

content.title: April
content.content:
9 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes a letter to Mr Hayward.
23 - Poet Roy Campbell dies.
24 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes Letter 196a.

content.title: May
content.content:
7 - Tolkien visits Cambridge to view the Ancrene Wisse manuscript.
9 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes letter 197.

content.title: June
content.content:
7 - Marquette University acquires many of Tolkien's manuscripts for 1,500 pounds.
9 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes a letter to William Ready.
24 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes letter 199.
25 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes letter 200.
26 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes a letter to Deirdre Levinson.

content.title: August
content.content:
5 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes two letters to Jerome W. Archer, Director of Libraries at Marquette University.
21 - Artist John Howe is born.
24 - Actor Stephen Fry is born.
25 - Author Ian Brodie is born.

content.title: September
content.content:
2 - Professor William Craigie, Tolkien's predecessor as Rawlinson and Bosworth Professor of Anglo-Saxon, dies.
4 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes letter 200a.
7 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes letter 201.
10 - J.R.R. Tolkien wins the International Fantasy Award.
11 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes letter 202.
11 - The Oxford Mail reports from the International Fantasy Award, won by Tolkien.
14 - The Bookseller reports from the International Fantasy Award, won by Tolkien.

content.title: November
content.content:
6 - Actor Cam Clarke is born.
9/10 - At midnight, J.R.R. Tolkien writes a letter to Przemyslaw Mroczkowski.
17 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes letter 203.
17 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes a letter to Przemyslaw Mroczkowski.

7 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes letter 204.
13 - J.R.R. Tolkien writes letter 204a.
